page.title: 05Thurnham
page.content: A few sheep are kept but most farms carry too many cows to be able to run sheep as well. The breeds are Mashams, Mules, and Suffolks. Mashams are Scottish black-faced crossed with Teeswater, and Mules are Scottish black-faced crossed with Border Leicester. The Suffolk "tups" (rams) are pure bred. The sheep are lambed in February which means they were "tupped" (mated) in October. The lambs are sold for meat in June at Lancaster Auction or to the Fatstock Marketing Corporation. Clipping is done in June, and the wool is sold to the Wool Marketing Board.
